title: Impôts en France
text:
#| standalone: true
#| components: [editor, viewer]
#| viewerHeight: 420

import numpy as np
from shiny import App, render, ui
from htmltools import css
import shinyswatch

app_ui = ui.page_fluid(
    {"class": "my-4"},
    shinyswatch.theme.superhero(),
    ui.panel_title("Impôts en France"),
    ui.input_slider("parts", "Nombre de parts", 1, 5, 2.5, step=.5),
    ui.input_numeric("net1", "Net fiscal 1", 50_000, min=1, max=1_000_000),
    ui.input_numeric("net2", "Net fiscal 2", 50_000, min=1, max=1_000_000),
    ui.output_text_verbatim("txt"),
)

# Tranches et demiparts en 2024 sur les revenus en 2023
T1 = 11_294
T2 = 28_797
T3 = 82_341
T4 = 177_106
demipart = 1_759

def impot(s):
  total = 0
  if s>T1 and s<=T2:
    total = (s-T1)*0.11
  elif s>T2 and s<=T3:
    total = (T2-T1)*0.11 + (s-T2)*0.3
  elif s>T3 and s<=T4:
    total = (T2-T1)*0.11 + (T3-T2)*0.3 + (s-T3)*0.41
  elif s>T4:
    total = (T2-T1)*0.11 + (T3-T2)*0.3 + (T4-T3)*0.41 + (s-T4)*0.45
  return total

def server(input, output, session):
    @output
    @render.text
    def txt():
        n1 = input.net1()
        n2 = input.net2()
        if n1 is None: n1 = 0
        if n2 is None: n2 = 0
        # abattement fiscal
        n1 = n1*.9
        n2 = n2*.9
        taxes = input.parts() * impot((n1+n2)/input.parts())
        if input.parts()>2:
            avantage_maximal_demipart = 2*impot((n1+n2)/2)-demipart*2*(input.parts()-2)
            if taxes < avantage_maximal_demipart: taxes = avantage_maximal_demipart
        return f"{taxes:,.0f} euros".replace(","," ")


app = App(app_ui, server)

title: About
text:
The official taxes simulator can be confusing even the simplified one. This project is just an extremely simplified estimation which can be wrong in many cases (isolated parents, people living outside metropolitan France, etc.) however it can be good enough for many people. Notice that none of the deductions are included (creches, aide a domicile, etc.) so you will need to estimate those as well. However, it has served me well to get a rough approximation of the taxes I will pay.
For any problem, contact me on Twitter: @alonsosilva
